meanings.definition: Transfer or delegate (power) to a lower level, especially from central government to local or regional administration.
meanings.sent1: The mayor devolved some of his responsibilities to the city council.
meanings.sent2: The decision was devolved to the committee for further discussion.
meanings.sent3: The power outage devolved into chaos as people scrambled for resources.
meanings.sent4: As the project progressed, the team devolved more authority to the junior members.
meanings.sent5: The teacher devolved the task of leading the class discussion to the student council president.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the relationship between the two friends devolved into constant arguments.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful protest quickly devolved into a violent confrontation.
meanings.sent3: The game night devolved into a silly competition of who could tell the worst jokes.
meanings.sent4: The once beautiful garden devolved into a wild tangle of weeds and overgrown plants.
meanings.sent5: The negotiations devolved into a shouting match as tempers flared.
